articles.headline: With Auto Show, G.M. Hopes to Lessen Damage
articles.snippet: The nation’s biggest automaker is blanketing the New York auto show with new products it hopes will improve its stagnant market share in America.
articles.abstract: The nation’s biggest automaker is blanketing the New York auto show with new products it hopes will improve its stagnant market share in America.
articles.lead_paragraph: After a huge safety crisis and a revolt by disgruntled investors, General Motors is eager to turn its attention back to cars and trucks.

articles.headline: Wall Street and Silicon Valley Form an Uneasy Alliance
articles.snippet: Entrepreneurs and venture capitalists have done their best to resist or reduce Wall Street’s entreaties, but it appears that a new relationship has begun to develop.
articles.abstract: Entrepreneurs and venture capitalists have done their best to resist or reduce Wall Street’s entreaties, but it appears that a new relationship has begun to develop.
articles.lead_paragraph: Silicon Valley has always had an uneasy relationship with Wall Street.

articles.headline: In Colorado, Marijuana Taxes May Have to Be Passed Back
articles.snippet: A strict anti-spending provision in the state Constitution may force Colorado to refund nearly $60 million intended for school construction and other needs.
articles.abstract: A strict anti-spending provision in the state Constitution may force Colorado to refund nearly $60 million intended for school construction and other needs.
articles.lead_paragraph: DENVER — In the State Capitol, they are calling it Refund Madness.

articles.headline: With Galaxy S6 and S6 Edge, Samsung Tries to Regain Its Footing
articles.snippet: The elegant new smartphones aim to answer many criticisms leveled at Samsung’s phones but are most likely not quite enough to fix what ails the company.
articles.abstract: The elegant new smartphones aim to answer many criticisms leveled at Samsung’s phones but are most likely not quite enough to fix what ails the company.
articles.lead_paragraph: Samsung’s internal code name for its latest top-of-the-line smartphones, the Galaxy S6 and S6 Edge, is “Project Zero,” signaling what Samsung calls “a return to fundamentals.”
